Package io.github.ai4ci.flow.output

Class DuckDBWriter<X extends OutputWriter.Writeable>

java.lang.Object
io.github.ai4ci.flow.output.DuckDBWriter<X>
Type Parameters:
X - the type of records to be written, which must implement CSVWriter.Writeable for CSV serialization
All Implemented Interfaces:
OutputWriter<X>, Closeable, AutoCloseable
public class DuckDBWriter<X extends OutputWriter.Writeable> extends Object implements OutputWriter<X>
OutputWriter implementation for writing records to a DuckDB database file. This writer uses a background thread to continuously flush records from a concurrent queue to the database, allowing for efficient batch inserts. The writer is designed to handle records of a specified type that implements CSVWriter.Writeable, and it manages the database connection, table creation, and record insertion in a thread-safe manner. The writer also provides methods for flushing the queue, checking if the writer is waiting for new records, and reporting the current status of the writer.

  • Constructor Details

    • DuckDBWriter

      public DuckDBWriter()
      Initialises a new DuckDBWriter instance. The actual setup of the database connection and table schema is performed in the setup method, which must be called before exporting any records. The constructor does not perform any operations on the database and is designed to allow for flexible initialization of the writer, with the setup method handling all necessary configuration based on the provided file and record type.

  • Method Details

    • close

      public void close()
      Description copied from interface: OutputWriter
      Close the output writer and release any resources associated with it. This method should ensure that all pending data is flushed to the output destination before closing, and that any threads or resources used for writing are properly terminated. Implementations should handle any necessary cleanup to prevent resource leaks and ensure that the output destination is left in a consistent state.
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface Closeable
      Specified by:

    • export

      public void export(X single)
      Description copied from interface: OutputWriter
      A non blocking thread safe export, allowing very quick handing off of a data export data class to whatever (single) thread that is going to write it to disk.
      Specified by:
      export in interface OutputWriter<X extends OutputWriter.Writeable>
      Parameters:
      single - a single data record of type X that implements Writeable to be exported; this method should return quickly and not block the calling thread, allowing for efficient handoff to the consumer thread that will handle the actual writing to the output destination

    • flush

      public void flush()
      Description copied from interface: OutputWriter
      Flush any buffered data to the output destination. This method should ensure that all data that has been handed off for writing is actually written to disk, and that any resources used for buffering are properly managed. Implementations should handle any necessary synchronization to ensure thread safety during the flush operation.
      Specified by:
      flush in interface OutputWriter<X extends OutputWriter.Writeable>

    • isWaiting

      public boolean isWaiting()
      Description copied from interface: OutputWriter
      Check if the consumer thread is currently waiting for data to be exported. This method can be used to monitor the state of the output writer and determine if it is idle or actively processing data. Implementations should provide a thread-safe way to check this state, allowing for coordination between the producer and consumer threads.
      Specified by:
      isWaiting in interface OutputWriter<X extends OutputWriter.Writeable>
      Returns:
      true if the consumer thread is waiting for data, false otherwise

    • join

      public void join() throws InterruptedException
      Description copied from interface: OutputWriter
      Wait for the consumer thread to finish processing all pending data and complete any ongoing write operations. This method should block until the consumer thread has finished writing all data to the output destination, ensuring that all exports are completed before proceeding with any shutdown or cleanup operations. Implementations should handle any necessary synchronization to ensure that this method works correctly in a multi-threaded environment.
      Specified by:
      join in interface OutputWriter<X extends OutputWriter.Writeable>
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted while waiting for the consumer thread to finish

    • report

      public String report()
      Description copied from interface: OutputWriter
      Provide a status report or performance metrics about the writing process. This method can be used to return information about the current state of the output writer, such as the number of records written, the time taken for recent exports, or any errors encountered during writing. Implementations can customize this method to provide relevant information based on the specific output format and destination being used.
      Specified by:
      report in interface OutputWriter<X extends OutputWriter.Writeable>
      Returns:
      a String containing the status report or performance metrics about the writing process

    • setup

      public void setup(Class<X> type, File file, int size) throws IOException
      Description copied from interface: OutputWriter
      Called once to setup an output destination and the consumer thread that writes data to it, (including buffer sizes if needed). As part of initialising this might write the headers for CSV files for example, or create the DuckDB table.
      Specified by:
      setup in interface OutputWriter<X extends OutputWriter.Writeable>
      Parameters:
      type - the Class object representing the type of data records that will be written, used for reflection or type-specific setup
      file - the File object representing the output destination (e.g. file path) where data will be written
      size - an integer representing the buffer size or batch size for writing data, which can be used to optimize performance based on the expected volume of data
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during setup, such as issues with file permissions, disk space, or other problems that prevent the output destination from being properly initialized
